docs.lead_paragraph: A neuroscientist discusses research suggesting that PTSD may be “physical” in nature.

docs.lead_paragraph: Overuse of narcotics and addiction are an issue, but emergency physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients complaining of tooth pain and seeking prescription painkillers.

headline.seo: Emergency Room Doctors, Dental Patients and Drugs
headline.main: E.R. Doctors Face Quandary on Painkillers
headline.print_headline: E.R. Doctors Face Dilemma On Painkillers

docs.abstract: Emergency department physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients who come in complaining of tooth pain; ER doctors not only lack dental tools and training, but it is known that many such patients are using tooth pain as a ruse to get prescriptions for narcotic painkillers.
docs.snippet: Overuse of narcotics and addiction are an issue, but emergency physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients complaining of tooth pain and seeking prescription painkillers.

docs.lead_paragraph: An icy clash between Gov. Mark Dayton, a Democrat, and Republican lawmakers shows the politics involved in a crucial element of the new federal health care law.

headline.seo: In Minnesota, Partisan Clash on Insurance Exchanges
headline.main: In Fight Over Obama Health Law, a Front in Minnesota
headline.print_headline: A Bitter Standoff as Minnesota Works to Set Up a Health Insurance Exchange

docs.abstract: Standoff between Minnesota Gov Mark Dayton, a Democrat, and state Republican lawmakers over setting up a health insurance marketplace for people who do not receive coverage from their employers highlights the politics involved in this crucial element of the new federal health care law.
docs.snippet: An icy clash between Gov. Mark Dayton, a Democrat, and Republican lawmakers shows the politics involved in a crucial element of the new federal health care law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW PRIORITY The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act has been at the center of a tug of war between business interests and federal authorities. The United States Chamber of Commerce has led efforts to change the law, in response to recent prosecutions by the Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission. But revelations that Wal-Mart Stores squelched an investigation into bribery at its Mexican subsidiary may impel prosecutors to be even more forceful and put legislative efforts to change the law on the back burner, according to White Collar Watch. PETER J. HENNING
docs.abstract: DealBook Online; Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, which has been at the center of a tug of war between business interests and federal authorities, may not change anytime soon; medical equipment maker Hologic will buy Gen-Probe for $3.72 billion; Aviva says chief executive Andrew Moss refuses a 2012 salary increase; Terra Firma agrees to buy British nursing home operator Four Seasons Health Care for up to 825 million pounds ($1.3 billion). Photos (M)
